info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 13 at 3:53AM EST until January 13 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwestern Connecticut, including the following areas, Northern Litchfield and Southern Litchfield. * WHEN...Through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Total rainfall overnight into early this morning will range from 0.50 to 1 inch. Given many rivers and streams are running high, renewed river or stream flooding is possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
